intro: Echites hebecarpus, commonly known as the narrow-fruit senna, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous pods and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are trifoliate, and it produces yellow flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. The fruit is a slender pod that contains several seeds, contributing to its ecological role in local habitats.
